quotes.quote: Never say never because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion.
Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
Run when you can, walk if you have to, crawl if you must; just never give up.
Don't give up at half time. Concentrate on winning the second half.
Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.
I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
You win some, you lose some, and some get rained out, but you gotta suit up for them all.
The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt.
My jump was imperfect, my run-in was too short and my hands were too far back at takeoff. When I manage to iron out these faults, I am sure I can improve.
Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward; they may be beaten, but they may start a winning game.
Being defeated is often a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent.

Champions do not become champions when they win the event, but in the hours, weeks, months and years they spend preparing for it. The victorious performance itself is merely the demonstration of their championship character.
A boy comes to me with a spark of interest. I feed the spark and it becomes a flame. I feed the flame and it becomes a fire. I feed the fire and it becomes a roaring blaze.
Anyone can support a team that is winning - it takes no courage. But to stand behind a team to defend a team when it is down and really needs you, that takes a lot of courage.
You are never really playing an opponent. You are playing yourself, your own highest standards, and when you reach your limits, that is real joy.
Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way.
Champions aren't made in the gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them - a desire, a dream, a vision.
The pitcher has got only a ball. I've got a bat. So the percentage of weapons is in my favor and I let the fellow with the ball do the fretting.
The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.
Competing in sports has taught me that if I'm not willing to give 120 percent, somebody else will.
The strength of the group is the strength of the leaders.
Ask not what your teammates can do for you. Ask what you can do for your teammates.
If you train hard, you'll not only be hard, you'll be hard to beat.
Victory is in having done your best. If you've done your best, you've won.
The key is not the will to win. Everybody has that. It is the will to prepare to win that is important.
It does not matter how many times you get knocked down, but how many times you get up.
Show me a guy who's afraid to look bad, and I'll show you a guy you can beat every time.
Leadership, like coaching, is fighting for the hearts and souls of men and getting them to believe in you.
Winning is not a sometime thing; it's an all the time thing. You don't win once in a while; you don't do things right once in a while; you do them right all of the time. Winning is a habit.
